The practice of suing negative reviewers is especially prevalent in the Food and Pharmaceutical corporations. They just want to keep the public dark on what they put in or do to their everyday products we use. I believe one of the meat companies attempted to sue Oprah over some negative remarks on how the food was manufactured.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b4c5c3636872209e4d0300#post_53b4c5c3636872209e4d0300
[bq="SeraphimDawn"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b4c4c76368725f5cc80300#post_53b4c4c76368725f5cc80300
So, basically, these dinosaurs are fucked if they don't go with the time.[/bq]
Pretty much; most of the internet is actually deep net of companies using fuck tons of super computers all across the world communicating with each other.

What we consider the internet actually only consists of 1% of the internet.  If companies or the government were to pull the plug on the internet the entire economy would crash completely and be unrecoverable cause many companies in the world outright rely on the internet; without the internet they'd die.

As much as say the RIAA hates the internet for piracy they can not exist as a company without the internet.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b4c70f63687248a1d30400#post_53b4c70f63687248a1d30400
But you got internet corporations such as Google, having almost a monopoly on internet services and content control. Who knows what the are capable of? If you can't get rid of the internet. Why not *control* it? With the privacy and G+ revelations, I could swear that Google is run by organized crime cartel, or at least, operate like one.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53b4c89f636872209e160400#post_53b4c89f636872209e160400
Nah; the problem is that a lot of companies are just dumb.  What I mean by this is that philosophically speaking "power" in a metaphorical sense is a illusion that one has control over every possible situation to which often times the real world proves naught.  To expand upon this even if google goes comic book villain they would only have control over a very small portion of the internet and thus have very little actual control.

While dangers of censorship and so forth are very real the problem with a lot of governments and companies is that they do it in a dumb ass way.

To use a recent example mainland china even though they forbid protesters from protesting a recent decision to shoot down democratization of hong kong 500k protesters showed up anyhow.

Direct censorship is stupid cause you're spending fuck tons of money on only moderate results.

A more sinister and more intelligent way of controlling people is through education; what I mean by this is that say you were a movie villain that wanted to control the world, the best way to do that would be through giving people education that they normally couldn't afford with biased books in your favor and college education in fields that would control things politically and/or in the courts and so forth.  For only a couple billion you could raise a entire generation of people who control the government.
